docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 4:22 p.m. | Gov. David A. Paterson, who become New York's chief executive on March 17 after his predecessor resigned in disgrace, on Wednesday delivered his first State of the State address, comparing the state's mounting fiscal crisis to other challenges that have confronted the state since the Revolution.
docs.abstract: Gov. David A. Paterson gave his first State of the State address, marking a turning point in the changeover of state government.
docs.snippet: Gov. David A. Paterson gave his first State of the State address, marking a turning point in the changeover of state government.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day after President-elect Barack Obama raised the possibility of "trillion-dollar deficits for years to come," he plans to discuss budgetary issues and introduce a new White House position, chief performance officer, at a press conference in Washington this morning.

headline.main: The Early Word: Focus on the Budget

docs.abstract: The president-elect plans to discuss budgetary issues and announce his choice for a new White House position, chief performance officer, at a press conference on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: The president-elect plans to discuss budgetary issues and announce his choice for a new White House position, chief performance officer, at a press conference on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A top aide for the state's attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, urged labor leaders and upstate officials to refrain from embracing Caroline Kennedy for New York's soon-to-be-vacant Senate seat, according to several people with direct knowledge of the conversations.

headline.main: A Cuomo Aide Tries to Slow Kennedy's Senate Bid

docs.abstract: Also in Morning Buzz: Arm twisting (and face slapping) for a Democratic State majority, a crash in the state's unemployment system and other headlines from local papers.
docs.snippet: Also in Morning Buzz: Arm twisting (and face slapping) for a Democratic State majority, a crash in the state's unemployment system and other headlines from local papers.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the city’s demographics shift, many elderly Italian immigrants see the tight-knit enclaves they built around the city slowly disappearing.

headline.main: For Italians in Brooklyn, Voices on Streets Have Changed
headline.print_headline: For Italians in Brooklyn, the Faces and the Voices on the Streets Have Changed

docs.lead_paragraph: The proposal by Gov. David A. Paterson would amount to a wide expansion of health insurance coverage to some 800,000 people 19 to 29 who are uninsured.

headline.seo: Paterson Measure Would Insure Dependents Up to Age 29
headline.main: Paterson Would Insure Dependents Up to Age 29
headline.print_headline: Paterson Would Insure Dependents Up to Age 29

docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama sought to distinguish between the need to run big deficits for several years and the need to reduce them later.

headline.main: Obama Warns of Prospect for Trillion-Dollar Deficits
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns of Prospect For Trillion-Dollar Deficits

docs.lead_paragraph: Part three of a three-part series on home health aides, published in The New Old Age.

headline.main: Home Health Aides: Present and Future

docs.abstract: Marki Flannery of Partners in Care discusses what the future holds once the baby boomers need home care for themselves.
docs.snippet: Marki Flannery of Partners in Care discusses what the future holds once the baby boomers need home care for themselves.

docs.lead_paragraph: National health spending grew in 2007 at the lowest rate in nine years, mainly because prescription drug spending increased at the slowest pace since 1963.

headline.main: Spending Rise for Health Care and Prescription Drugs Slows
headline.print_headline: Spending Rise for Health Care and Prescription Drugs Slows
